*div1 type="summary"* *p*Thomas Gray to Austin, January 23, 1825. Misunderstanding about the land that he desired.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p**location_mentioned*Colorado */location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="01-23-1825">January 23rd 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir I received verbal information from you by *person_mentioned*Capt Burnham*/person_mentioned* informing me that neither of the Leagues selected by me; as my choice would be entered by you in my name; if I have intrudad upon you by presenting to you in writing the *location_mentioned*7th 8th and 12 Leagues */location_mentioned*as my choice of either please excuse the intrusion. Were I placed in affluence as is the situation of some of your applicants I am of opinion that you would have attended to and recd my Entry by *person_mentioned*Capt Burnham*/person_mentioned*. I hope you may bestow the Land;, or rather sell it to a more worthy than I am; I wish every thing that may contribute to the wellfare of the *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, to your health and happiness */p* *p*N. B. Sir I would be thankful to you if you would confer the favour upon me of sending me a Certificate Certifying that I have no land in this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned* and oblige your friend
*/p**p**person_mentioned*Thomas Gray*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
